results.title: What did you do in the war Mummy? [kit]
results.creator_credit: Felicity Cockram, ImMEDIAte Action, Australian War Memorial and History Teacher's Association of Victoria
results.brief_description: Subtitled Images of Australian women in wartime this kit aims to identify the real contribution that women made during both world wars and also at the images of women in wartime that were projected. Authored by Tim Gurry, Robert Lewis and Richard Reid, the kit draws together a wide variety of material with suggestions for its use, into nine Evidence Files, a videocassette and Teacher’s notes.

results.title: What did you do in the Great War Mummy?
results.brief_description: This film shows that there have traditionally been two labour markets in Britain based on the concepts of “mens” work and “women’s work”. Traces the history of women workers in the twentieth century with emphasis on the roles they played during the two world wars. These national emergencies shaped the change in attitudes regarding women and work, and during those conflicts, “a woman’s place” was no longer just in the home.

results.title: What did you do at school today
results.creator_credit: John Power, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Through an experience in outback camping in South Australia, a number of secondary school students learn the value of group co-operation. The decisions necessary to establish a comfortable and smooth-running campsite are made by the students themselves. Also, the shortcomings in their planning are shown - often humorously. Each student has an important part in a sequence of activities.

results.title: What comes out of the blast furnace?
results.creator_credit: John Wiles, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description: In addition to iron, the furnace produces slag and gas. The film describes the uses to which all three can be put. Explains that the object of the blast furnace is the smelt iron, but in the process other things are also produced, such as slag which collects in the hearth of the furnace together with the hot metal, and gas, which passes out of the top of the furnace. Shows how these products are treated and the uses to which they are put. Makes the point that very little is allowed to go to waste in a modern iron works.

results.title: What can I do?
results.creator_credit: Jerry A Callner and Callner Film Productions
results.brief_description: The democratic system of government is a system meant for participation and involvement. Citizens can influence ongoing social change through personal political and social action. The use of the media, the impact of effective letters to the press and local members, and the power of the single vote are all examined.

results.title: What becomes of the broken hearted?
results.creator_credit: Ian Mune, Bill Gavin and Sequel Productions
results.brief_description: It’s five years from where “Once were warriors” left us, and Jake the Muss has turned his back on his family - breaking old habits is not as easy. His long suffering wife, Beth (Rena Owen), has left him and is living with someone new. Jake too has started a new relationship which is punctuated by violence and alcohol abuse. He is reunited with Beth and younger son, Sonny (Clint Eruera), at the funeral of Nig, who died in a gang fight. Tensions flare between Jake and Sonny, and as Sonny delves deeper into the dangerous world of gangs to gain retribution for his elder brother’s death, Jake must face, once and for all, the demons of the past and open up to the possibility of change, and survival.

results.title: What are you running for? = Qusque tu vas de meme?
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, Francois Seguillon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The running of the Fernand Grenier Race, an annual 67 kilometer relay foot race between the villages of La Guadeloupe and Lac Megantic, Quebec, during the first weeked in October. Competitors come from all parts of the province to run in the five-hour marathon. This film covers the entire race, often employing multi-image techniques to show more than one runner at a time. The film has no commentary.

results.title: What are words worth: copyright, CAL & sampling
results.creator_credit: Barry Jacobs, Copyright Agency Ltd and Serious Business TV Production
results.brief_description: The purpose of copyright is to protect the intellectual property of writers thus ensuring they are given the renumeration to which they are entitled. This program explains copyright issues such as the function of CAL and why it conducts copying surveys, the importance of copyright protection not only for authors but the whole community and the advantages of a centralised licensing and CAL sampling system. The program uses role play with actors to impart the important message about copyright.

results.title: What are we doing to our children? Part 2: welfare and the fatherless family
results.brief_description: Looks at the consequences of America’s Welfare system on young children. Daycare centers, unwed or working others, absentee fathers due to the welfare “man in the house” rule combine to inflict trauma on young children.
